intro: Hypochaeris lasiophylla, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, exhibiting a low-growing, herbaceous habit. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, while the flowers are yellow with a prominent central disk. It produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
